gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players command advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. Combining strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, the game focus on the crucial roles bees play in our world.

setting.location: Various global locations affected by natural disasters.
setting.missionEnd: Bee Populations stabilized and habitats restored

blueTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Experts in ecological technology deployment and habitat creation.

redTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Specializing in species recovery and public awareness campaigns.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane Recovery scenario strikes. Both teams must decide between planting native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats (A) or establishing new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster (B). Additional challenges requiring water conservation system or endangered species surveying might arise.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones, ensuring their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose to restore native species, improving the biodiversity but pressure is still on bee populations in other disaster-hit zones. Demonstrating mutual commitment to habitat restoration, this early collaboration bodes well.

AB.narrative: Red team focused on planting native flowers while the Blue team started new colonies. Diversifying their approaches both teams complemented each other, ensuring maximum benefits for the bee populations.

BA.narrative: Switching roles, the Blue team implemented plant restoration while Red established colonies. This diverse approach ensure both habitats and bee populations are concurrently augmenting.

BB.narrative: The teams opted to establishing colonies in safe zones, creating a safety net for bee populations but leaving much of their potential habitat degraded.

turns.scenario: Post wildfire recovery calls for quick action. Option A allows seeding fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation while option B focuses on creating artificial bee habitats. Additional challenges might arise involving fire-resistant vegetation programs or sustainable land management practices.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions

AA.narrative: Both teams took on the task of seeding bee-friendly vegetation, transforming barren lands into potential bee havens. This direct action shows their dedication, striking a balance between nature and technology.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators seeds the area while Bombus Navigators establishes new habitats, providing a two-pronged approach. Collaboration turns devastation into hope as greenery returns and bees begin colonizing the new habitats.

BA.narrative: The Bombus Navigators turn to seeding while Apis Aviators begin habitat creation, showing adaptability and collaboration. Both initiatives ensure a better future for the environmentally-stricken sites.

BB.narrative: Both teams concentrate on creating artificial habitats, providing bees with immediate shelter. Despite restoring vegetation is slower, they ensure bee survival in the short term.

turns.scenario: For the final turn, sustainable expansion is key. Option A involves developing bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology while option B focuses on launching educational campaigns.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams went full-on into technological advancements, developing state-of-the-art bee sanctuaries. Massive strides in habitat creation are achieved, but public awareness still lacks.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators dives into sanctuary development, while Bombus Navigators spearheads public education initiatives. Their joint efforts amplify each other, leading to widespread changes in bee conservation efforts.

BA.narrative: Swapping roles for a balanced approach, the Bombus Navigators develop advanced sanctuaries while Apis Aviators initiate educational campaigns. Together, they create a powerful combination of conservation and awareness strategies.

BB.narrative: Both teams focus on education and advocacy, sparking worldwide changes in attitudes and practices towards bee conservation. Although lacking in technical advancements, a global bee-friendly community emerges.
